verses.kjv: In the mean time, when there were gathered together an innumerable multitude of people, insomuch that they trode one upon another, he began to say unto his disciples first of all, Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, a crowd of thousands had gathered, so packed together that people were stepping on each other. Jesus spoke first to his disciples: "Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees — their hypocrisy.

verses.kjv: For there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; neither hid, that shall not be known.
verses.ct: Everything that is concealed will eventually be exposed, and every secret will come to light.

verses.kjv: Therefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops.
verses.ct: So whatever you've said in the dark will be heard in broad daylight, and what you've whispered behind closed doors will be announced from the rooftops.

verses.kjv: And I say unto you my friends, Be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.
verses.ct: I'm telling you, my friends — don't be afraid of those who can kill the body but can't do anything more after that.

verses.kjv: But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear: Fear him, which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, Fear him.
verses.ct: Let me tell you who to truly revere: revere the one who, after killing, has the authority to throw you into hell. Yes, I'm telling you — revere him.

verses.kjv: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings, and not one of them is forgotten before God?
verses.ct: Aren't 5 sparrows sold for just 2 small coins? Yet not a single one of them is overlooked by God.

verses.kjv: But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows.
verses.ct: In fact, every hair on your head has been counted. So don't be afraid — you are worth far more than many sparrows.

verses.kjv: Also I say unto you, Whosoever shall confess me before men, him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God:
verses.ct: I also tell you this: everyone who publicly acknowledges me, the Son of Man will also acknowledge them in front of God's angels.

verses.kjv: But he that denieth me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.
verses.ct: But whoever disowns me in front of others will be disowned in front of God's angels.

verses.kjv: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven.
verses.ct: Anyone who speaks against the Son of Man can be forgiven, but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.

verses.kjv: And when they bring you unto the synagogues, and unto magistrates, and powers, take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall answer, or what ye shall say:
verses.ct: When they drag you before synagogues, rulers, and authorities, don't worry about how to defend yourselves or what to say.

verses.kjv: For the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say.
verses.ct: The Holy Spirit will teach you at that very moment what you need to say."

verses.kjv: And one of the company said unto him, Master, speak to my brother, that he divide the inheritance with me.
verses.ct: Someone in the crowd called out to him, "Teacher, tell my brother to split the inheritance with me."

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Man, who made me a judge or a divider over you?
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Friend, who appointed me as a judge or arbitrator between you two?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man’s life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.
verses.ct: Then he said to them all, "Be on guard and stay away from every kind of greed, because a person's life is not measured by how much they own."

verses.kjv: And he spake a parable unto them, saying, The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully:
verses.ct: He then told them a parable: "A wealthy man's land produced an enormous harvest.

verses.kjv: And he thought within himself, saying, What shall I do, because I have no room where to bestow my fruits?
verses.ct: He thought to himself, 'What am I going to do? I don't have enough space to store all my crops.'

verses.kjv: And he said, This will I do: I will pull down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods.
verses.ct: Then he said, 'Here's what I'll do — I'll tear down my barns and construct bigger ones, and I'll store all my grain and goods there.

verses.kjv: And I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast much goods laid up for many years; take thine ease, eat, drink, and be merry.
verses.ct: Then I'll say to myself: You've got plenty stored up for years to come. Relax! Eat, drink, and enjoy yourself.'

verses.kjv: But God said unto him, Thou fool, this night thy soul shall be required of thee: then whose shall those things be, which thou hast provided?
verses.ct: But God said to him, 'You fool! Tonight your life will be taken from you. Then who will get everything you've accumulated?'

verses.kjv: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.
verses.ct: That's how it goes for anyone who stockpiles wealth for themselves but isn't rich in their relationship with God."

verses.kjv: And he said unto his disciples, Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat; neither for the body, what ye shall put on.
verses.ct: Then Jesus said to his disciples, "That's why I'm telling you — stop worrying about your life, what you'll eat, or about your body, what you'll wear.

verses.kjv: The life is more than meat, and the body is more than raiment.
verses.ct: Life is about more than food, and the body is about more than clothing.

verses.kjv: Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap; which neither have storehouse nor barn; and God feedeth them: how much more are ye better than the fowls?
verses.ct: Think about the ravens — they don't plant or harvest, and they have no storerooms or barns, yet God provides for them. How much more valuable are you than birds!

verses.kjv: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?
verses.ct: Which of you can add a single moment to your life by worrying?

verses.kjv: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least, why take ye thought for the rest?
verses.ct: If you can't even accomplish something that small, why stress about the rest?

verses.kjv: Consider the lilies how they grow: they toil not, they spin not; and yet I say unto you, that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.ct: Think about how the wildflowers grow — they don't work or make fabric. Yet I'm telling you, not even Solomon in all his glory was dressed as beautifully as one of them.

verses.kjv: If then God so clothe the grass, which is to day in the field, and to morrow is cast into the oven; how much more will he clothe you, O ye of little faith?
verses.ct: If God dresses the grass like that — here in the field today and thrown into the fire tomorrow — how much more will he take care of clothing you, you people of little faith?

verses.kjv: And seek not ye what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubtful mind.
verses.ct: So stop obsessing over what you'll eat or drink, and don't let your minds be consumed with anxiety.

verses.kjv: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after: and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.
verses.ct: The people of the world chase after all these things, but your Father already knows you need them.

verses.kjv: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God; and all these things shall be added unto you.
verses.ct: Instead, pursue the kingdom of God, and all these things will be provided to you as well.

verses.kjv: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
verses.ct: Don't be afraid, little flock, because your Father is delighted to give you the kingdom.

verses.kjv: Sell that ye have, and give alms; provide yourselves bags which wax not old, a treasure in the heavens that faileth not, where no thief approacheth, neither moth corrupteth.
verses.ct: Sell your possessions and give to those in need. Make for yourselves wallets that never wear out — an inexhaustible treasure in heaven where no thief can reach it and no moth can destroy it.

verses.kjv: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.ct: Because wherever your treasure is, that's where your heart will be too.

verses.kjv: Let your loins be girded about, and your lights burning;
verses.ct: Stay prepared and keep your lamps lit.

verses.kjv: And ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their lord, when he will return from the wedding; that when he cometh and knocketh, they may open unto him immediately.
verses.ct: Be like servants waiting for their master to return from a wedding celebration, ready to open the door for him the moment he arrives and knocks.

verses.kjv: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serve them.
verses.ct: How fortunate are those servants whose master finds them alert and ready when he comes! I'm telling you the truth — he will get himself ready, have them sit down at the table, and come out to serve them personally.

verses.kjv: And if he shall come in the second watch, or come in the third watch, and find them so, blessed are those servants.
verses.ct: Whether he arrives at midnight or just before dawn, those servants are fortunate if he finds them ready.

verses.kjv: And this know, that if the goodman of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched, and not have suffered his house to be broken through.
verses.ct: Understand this: if a homeowner had known what time a burglar was coming, he would have stayed awake and not let his house be broken into.

verses.kjv: Be ye therefore ready also: for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not.
verses.ct: You also need to be ready, because the Son of Man will come at a time you don't expect."

verses.kjv: Then Peter said unto him, Lord, speakest thou this parable unto us, or even to all?
verses.ct: Peter asked, "Lord, are you directing this parable at us, or at everyone?"

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, Who then is that faithful and wise steward, whom his lord shall make ruler over his household, to give them their portion of meat in due season?
verses.ct: The Lord responded, "Who then is the trustworthy and wise manager that the master puts in charge of his household to distribute their food at the proper time?

verses.kjv: Blessed is that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.
verses.ct: That servant is fortunate if the master arrives and finds him doing exactly that.

verses.kjv: Of a truth I say unto you, that he will make him ruler over all that he hath.
verses.ct: I'm telling you the truth — the master will put him in charge of everything he owns.

verses.kjv: But and if that servant say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming; and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken;
verses.ct: But suppose that servant thinks to himself, 'My master is taking a long time to get back,' and starts beating the other servants, both men and women, and starts eating, drinking, and getting drunk.

verses.kjv: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for him, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him in sunder, and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.
verses.ct: That servant's master will show up on a day he doesn't expect and at a time he isn't aware of. The master will cut him off and assign him a place with the unfaithful.

verses.kjv: And that servant, which knew his lord’s will, and prepared not himself, neither did according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes.
verses.ct: The servant who understood his master's wishes but didn't get ready or carry them out will receive a severe punishment.

verses.kjv: But he that knew not, and did commit things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few stripes. For unto whomsoever much is given, of him shall be much required: and to whom men have committed much, of him they will ask the more.
verses.ct: But the one who didn't know and did things deserving punishment will receive a lighter one. From everyone who has been given much, much will be demanded. And from the one who has been entrusted with much, even more will be expected.

verses.kjv: I am come to send fire on the earth; and what will I, if it be already kindled?
verses.ct: I came to bring fire to the earth, and how I wish it were already blazing!

verses.kjv: But I have a baptism to be baptized with; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished!
verses.ct: But I have a baptism to undergo, and how distressed I am until it is completed!

verses.kjv: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth? I tell you, Nay; but rather division:
verses.ct: Do you think I came to bring peace to the earth? No, I'm telling you — I came to bring division.

verses.kjv: For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.
verses.ct: From now on, a family of 5 will be split apart — 3 against 2 and 2 against 3.

verses.kjv: The father shall be divided against the son, and the son against the father; the mother against the daughter, and the daughter against the mother; the mother in law against her daughter in law, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.
verses.ct: Fathers will turn against sons and sons against fathers, mothers against daughters and daughters against mothers, mothers-in-law against daughters-in-law and daughters-in-law against mothers-in-law."

verses.kjv: And he said also to the people, When ye see a cloud rise out of the west, straightway ye say, There cometh a shower; and so it is.
verses.ct: Then he said to the crowd, "When you see clouds forming in the west, you immediately say, 'Rain is coming,' and it does.

verses.kjv: And when ye see the south wind blow, ye say, There will be heat; and it cometh to pass.
verses.ct: When the south wind blows, you say, 'It's going to be scorching hot,' and it is.

verses.kjv: Ye hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth; but how is it that ye do not discern this time?
verses.ct: Hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the heavens, but why can't you interpret what's happening right now?

verses.kjv: Yea, and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?
verses.ct: And why don't you judge for yourselves what is right?

verses.kjv: When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate, as thou art in the way, give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him; lest he hale thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and the officer cast thee into prison.
verses.ct: When you're on your way to court with someone who has a case against you, do everything you can to settle the matter while you're still on the road. Otherwise, they may drag you before the judge, the judge will hand you over to the officer, and the officer will throw you in prison.

verses.kjv: I tell thee, thou shalt not depart thence, till thou hast paid the very last mite.
verses.ct: I'm telling you, you won't get out of there until you've paid back every last penny."
